required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of the Decannulation Protocol With Suctioning and Capping in Severe Acquired Brain Injury Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Tracheostomy Decannulation in Severe Acquired Brain Injury: a Decannulation Protocol With Suctioning or Capping?

lead_sponsor.agency: Fu Xing Hospital, Capital Medical University

clinical_study.source: Fu Xing Hospital, Capital Medical University

brief_summary.textblock:
Single-center randomized trail focused on tracheostomized patients with severe acquired brain injury , comparing two different decannulation protocols:
1. an assessment of readiness for decannulation that was based on suctioning frequency
2. an assessment that was based on tracheostomy capping

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization to decannulation, and the patients will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 3 months
primary_outcome.description: the time from randomization to actual decannulation

secondary_outcome.measure: high dependency unit length of stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of high dependency unit admission to transferring to rehabilitation ward, and the patients will be followed for the duration of high dependency unit stay, an expected average of 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: the time from high dependency unit admission to rehabilitation ward

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of high dependency unit admission to hospital discharge, and the patients will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: post decannulation respiratory infections rate in each study group

secondary_outcome.measure: Glasgow Outcome Scale(GOS) six months after the acute brain injury
secondary_outcome.description: The GOS is a brief descriptive outcome scale(from 0 point to 29 points, higher score means worse outcome). GOS six months after discharge to asess the prognosis of the patient

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Independence Measure(FIM) six months after the acute brain injury
secondary_outcome.time_frame: follow up six months after discharge
secondary_outcome.description: The FIM is an 18-item ordinal scale, is viewed as most useful for assessment of progress during inpatient rehabilitation（from 18 points to 126 points, higher score means better outcome）.

arm_group.description: In the control group, the decision to decannulate was based on a 48-hour capping trial.
In the intervention group, the decision to decannulate was based on suctioning frequency.

intervention.description: In the intervention group, the decision to decannulate was based on suctioning frequency. Patients underwent decannulation when they had had no more than two aspirations every 8 hours during during a 24-hour period. Patients in this group did not undergo capping trials.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Within three months of onset
- Age≥18 years old
- GCS≥8
- Clinical stability( defined as the absence of fever, sepsis, or active infection and hemodynamic stability)
- Without massive pooling or silent aspiration of saliva, more than one efficient swallow per minute, adequate cough reflex were tested by gently touching the aryepiglottic region with the tip of the endoscope.
- Passing a tracheostomy-tube de-cuff test(de-cuff the tube for 3 days without pulmonary complications.
- Without significant airway stenosis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with pending diagnostic or therapeutic procedures and were considered by the clinicians to be at risk for neurologic deterioration
- Medical history of severe respiratory system or heart disease
- Neuromuscular disease other than ICU-acquired weakness, or tracheostomy for airway control
- Don't get informed consent from patient or guardian

overall_official.affiliation: Rehabilitation medicine center, Fuxing hospital, capital medical university

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fu Xing Hospital, Capital Medical University

patient_data.ipd_description: all IPD that underlie results in a publication are to be shared
